alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Lantana, Atlantis, Village Of Golf, Dunes Road, Kings Point, Hypoluxo, Gulf Stream, Villages Of Oriole, Aberdeen, Aberdeen Golf Course, Morikami Park and Seminole Manor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
